page.title: 01GEOGRAPHY OF BALDERTON.
page.content: { {SITUATION}The village is in East Notts. being about 30 kms from Lincoln and Leicester with the Fosse Way, a Roman Road, linking the two cities.Newark is 3 kms away in a N.W. direction and Mansfield 27kms away in a W.N.W. direction. Balderton is easily found on the new A.1. road. {SITE}Balderton grew on good fertile soil. There is a road called Spring Lane which suggests a local source of water. The village is built around St. Giles'Church which was built on a slight rise in the centre of the village. {CHANGES}'Village'is not a good word to use when describing Balderton as it is almost a small town. It has grown rapidly since the 1920's and houses have been built on the farmland so fewer farms remain.
